(1 Nephi 22:11; Mosiah 12:24; 15:31; 3 Nephi 16:20; 20:35)."The Lord hath made bare his holy arm." The Lord will show forth His power, specifically in leading people to salvation. Nephi states that "the kindreds of the earth cannot be blessed unless [God] shall make bare his arm." How will they be blessed? According to Nephi, "The Lord God will proceed to make bare his arm in the eyes of all the nations, in bringing about his covenants and his gospel unto those who are of the house of Israel." He goes on to state that the people will be brought "out of captivity" as well as "out of obscurity and out of darkness; and they shall know that the Lord is their Savior and their Redeemer, the Mighty One of Israel." (1 Nephi 22:10-11; italics added.)

In His second recitation of this verse, the resurrected Savior substituted the word "Father" for "Lord." He then emphasized that "the Father and I are one." Whatever Jesus does, it is what the Father would do and has His full approval.
